studyDesigns.name: Study Design
studyDesigns.rationale: Protocol-defined study design for investigating efficacy and safety

arms.name: EV ICD System
arms.description: Participants receive implantation of the ExtraVascular Implantable Cardioverter Defibrillator (EV ICD) System with the lead implanted substernally

objectives.name: Primary Safety Objective
objectives.text: Characterize the freedom from major complications related to the EV ICD System and/or procedure at 2 weeks post-implant.

objectives.name: Primary Efficacy Objective
objectives.text: Characterize the defibrillation efficacy at implant of the EV ICD System.

objectives.name: Ancillary Objective - Appropriate and Inappropriate Shocks
Ancillary Objective - Electrical Performance
objectives.text: Characterize electrical performance (pacing capture thresholds, pacing impedance, sensing amplitudes) over time

objectives.name: Ancillary Objective - ATP Performance
objectives.text: Summarize ATP performance with spontaneous arrhythmias

objectives.name: Ancillary Objective - Chronic Defibrillation Testing
objectives.text: Characterize EV ICD defibrillation testing conducted per physician discretion

endpoints.name: Major Complication-Free Rate at 2 Weeks
endpoints.text: A subject's first occurrence of a major complication related to the EV ICD System and/or procedure, as determined by an independent Clinical Events Committee (CEC), that occurs on or prior to 2 weeks (14 days) post-implant. Major complications are those complications resulting in: Death, Permanent loss of defibrillation function (specifically shock) due to mechanical or electrical dysfunction of the device, Hospitalization, Prolongation of an existing hospitalization by at least 48 hours, System revision (reposition, replacement, explant).

endpoints.name: Defibrillation Testing Success Rate at Implant
endpoints.text: Defibrillation testing success, defined as: Single sustained shockable ventricular arrhythmia (SSVA) conversion at 20J, or Conversion of two consecutive episodes of SSVA at 30J in final system configuration.

endpoints.name: Appropriate and Inappropriate Shocks
endpoints.text: Characterization of appropriate and inappropriate shocks

endpoints.name: Electrical Performance Over Time
endpoints.text: Characterization of electrical performance (pacing capture thresholds, pacing impedance, sensing amplitudes) over time

endpoints.name: ATP Performance with Spontaneous Arrhythmias
endpoints.text: Summary of ATP performance with spontaneous arrhythmias

endpoints.name: Chronic Defibrillation Testing
endpoints.text: Characterization of EV ICD chronic defibrillation conducted per physician discretion

studyInterventions.name: EV ICD System
studyInterventions.description: Extravascular Implantable Cardioverter Defibrillator system for automated treatment of life-threatening ventricular tachyarrhythmias

studyInterventions.name: EV2401 Extravascular Lead
studyInterventions.description: Extravascular lead for insertion into the mediastinum

studyInterventions.name: EAZ101 Sternal Tunneling Tool
studyInterventions.description: Tool for creating tunnel and facilitating lead insertion

studyInterventions.name: Transverse Tunneling Tool
studyInterventions.description: Tool for transverse tunneling to the device pocket

studyInterventions.name: Oscor SafeSheath II Model SSCL9
studyInterventions.description: Introducer sheath used over tunneling rod to create tunnel and facilitate lead insertion with saline-filled syringe connected to infusion sideport

studyInterventions.name: EV ICD Programmer Software Model SW041
studyInterventions.description: Investigational programmer software Version 8.3.1 or greater for device interrogation, control of induction, shocking, sensing and pacing features

studyInterventions.name: MyCareLink Patient Monitor Model 24952
studyInterventions.description: Patient monitor for transmitting device episode data to clinic via CareLink network

activities.name: Adverse Events (including AEs with fatal outcome), Device Deficiencies, HCUs, Study Deviations, and Other Cardiac Imaging
activities.description: Adverse Events (including AEs with fatal outcome), Device Deficiencies, HCUs, Study Deviations, and Other Cardiac Imaging

notes.text: 1 Required for subjects presenting in atrial fibrillation to confirm the absence of LA or LV thrombus.
2 Taken within the last year. Recommended for first 3 subjects at minimum, for each implanter. If collected/reviewed, send CT-scan and/or MRI to Medtronic.
3 Optional. If electrical testing conducted, print the Testing Reports to PDF or paper and send a copy of the reports to Medtronic
4 System modification where a subject leaves the procedure with an EV ICD System.
5 Recommended to collect incision photographs if an infection related to the EV ICD System is suspected.

medicalDevices.name: EV ICD System
medicalDevices.label: Extravascular Implantable Cardioverter Defibrillator System
medicalDevices.description: Complete single-chamber extravascular ICD system with the lead implanted substernally for automated treatment of life-threatening ventricular tachyarrhythmias

medicalDevices.name: EV ICD Lead
medicalDevices.label: Extravascular Lead
medicalDevices.description: Lead designed specifically for the substernal space for pacing, sensing, and defibrillation

medicalDevices.name: Sternal Tunneling Tool
medicalDevices.label: Sternal Tunneling Tool
medicalDevices.description: Investigational tool for substernal tunneling during EV ICD implant procedure

medicalDevices.name: Transverse Tunneling Tool
medicalDevices.label: Transverse Tunneling Tool
medicalDevices.description: Investigational tool designed to deliver the proximal portion of an extravascular lead to the device pocket during implant of an extravascular implantable device system (Zone 2)

medicalDevices.name: SafeSheath II Introducer
medicalDevices.label: SafeSheath
medicalDevices.description: Hemostatic tear-away introducer for introduction of pacing leads and catheters with infusion side port for injection or aspiration

medicalDevices.name: 10cc Plastic Syringe
medicalDevices.label: Syringe
medicalDevices.description: 10cc plastic syringe packaged with the introducer sheath

medicalDevices.name: MyCareLink Patient Monitor
medicalDevices.label: MyCareLink
medicalDevices.description: Patient monitor for remote monitoring of the EV ICD System

medicalDevices.name: Fluoroscope
medicalDevices.label: Fluoroscope
medicalDevices.description: Imaging equipment for fluoroscopy during implant procedure, must support full (90) lateral fluoroscopy (biplane preferred)

medicalDevices.name: Programmer Software
medicalDevices.label: Software
medicalDevices.description: Software for programming and interrogating the EV ICD System

conditions.name: Unfavorable Mediastinal Anatomy
conditions.text: If the implanter feels the subject has unfavorable mediastinal anatomy, the procedure shall not be attempted

conditions.name: Pre-implant Anatomy Evaluation
conditions.description: Physical assessment criteria for substernal access
conditions.text: Assess the subject in a supine position to evaluate potential abdominal interference to safely access substernal space and operator's ability to palpate xiphoid process, costal-rib margins and left sternal border

conditions.name: Anticoagulation Management
conditions.text: Subjects on anticoagulants have oral and/or systemic anticoagulants withheld peri-procedurally in order to reduce risk of bleeding/hematoma

conditions.name: CT/MRI Review Requirement for New Implanters
conditions.description: Imaging review requirement for implanter experience
conditions.text: It is also recommended to review a CT-scan (cardiac gated preferred) or MRI (taken within the last year) for the first 3 subjects at minimum, for each implanter

transitionRules.name: Baseline to Implant Transition
transitionRules.text: It is recommended that the implant visit occurs within 30 days of study enrollment

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Unfavorable Anatomy
transitionRules.text: If the implanter feels the subject has unfavorable mediastinal anatomy, the procedure shall not be attempted, and the subject shall be exited from the study

transitionRules.name: Exclusion Criterion 6 Exit
transitionRules.text: Confirm the subject does not meet exclusion criterion 6 during pre-implant anatomy evaluation

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Subject Withdrawal or Discontinuation
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Subject may be withdrawn or discontinued as described in section 8.19

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Unfavorable Anatomy Exit
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Subject exited from study if implanter determines unfavorable mediastinal anatomy

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study-wide Suspension or Early Termination
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Study-wide suspension or early termination as described in section 14.8

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Investigator/Site Suspension or Early Termination
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Investigator or site level suspension or early termination

commentAnnotations.text: Subjects can return for testing on another day if testing is not fully completed on the day of implant
If SSVA cannot be induced, the EV ICD System must be removed

Participating sites that enroll faster than others will be allowed to do so to maintain an adequate enrollment rate. However, to ensure a reasonable distribution of experience and minimize site bias in study results, the maximum number of subjects enrolled at each site will be capped at 12 (approximately 50% of 15 total enrollments)
The CIP permits up to 25 enrollments to allow about 15 subjects undergoing system implant and defibrillation testing to be included in the study
MyCareLink Patient Monitor Model 24952 (may become available during the course of the study)
It is strongly recommended to use general anesthesia with cardiac monitoring during the implant procedure to prevent subject movement and minimize the likelihood of adverse events during procedure
Reminder: After each induced SSVA episode, save-to-media files shall be collected
